reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Continued achievement of Universal Access of HIV/Sexually Transmitted Infections Prevention, Treatment and Care services in Cambodia

description.narrative: Cambodia managed to reduce its HIV prevalence from 2 percent in 1998 to 0.7 percent in 2010 which is mainly attributed to the “100 percent condom use” program among entertainment workers. Despite these results, Cambodia still faces challenges in addressing HIV, with more than 56,200 people living with HIV as of 2010, of which 46,000 are in need for antiretroviral treatment (ART). The program aims to maintain comprehensive care and treatment, including anti-retroviral drug provision, for all people living with HIV in need of treatment up to 2015 and to provide sole funding for ART. It seeks to maintain Cambodia’s dedication to Universal Access by addressing challenges identified by the National Strategic Plan for HIV/AIDS III such as reducing financial cost of ART and continuing of integration of the Continuum of Care (CoC) framework into the wider health system to better reach Most-at-Risk Populations (MARPs). The grant activities strengthen coordination and monitoring capacity within and across national and provincial multi-sectoral initiatives and the scale up of illicit drug related HIV/AIDS programs as a key component to achieve Cambodia’s Universal Access targets.

Coverage / Output indicator for KHM-H-NCHADS
Percentage of TG that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of MSM that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of MSM reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of TG reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Number of needles and syringes distributed per person who injects drugs per year by needle and syringe programs
Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of people who inject drugs that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of pregnant women who know their HIV status
Percentage of HIV-positive patients who were screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Percentage of TB patients who had an HIV test result recorded in the TB register
Percentage of infants born to HIV-positive women receiving a virological test for HIV within 2 months of birth
Percentage of adults and children that initiated ART, with an undetectable viral load at 12 months (<1000 copies/ml)
Percentage of individuals receiving Opioid Substitution Therapy who received treatment for at least 6 months
Percentage of people who inject drugs reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of people living with HIV currently receiving antiretroviral therapy
Percentage of new HIV-positive patients starting IPT during the reporting period
Percentage of HIV-positive pregnant women who received antiretrovirals to reduce the risk of mother-to-child transmission
Percentage of HIV-positive registered TB patients given anti-retroviral therapy during TB treatment
Percentage of people living with HIV that initiated ART with a CD4 count of <200 cells/mm³
